note.div:
This parameter specifes an XPath query which is applied on the xml representation of the Scheduler Event. If the XPath query returns a result, the order will be set to the next_state.
If the XPath query returns no result, the order will be set to the error_state.
Examples:
//event[@event_class='foo']
Successfull if an Event of the event class "foo" exists>
[event/@event_id='foo']
Successfull if an Event of the event id "foo" exists
//events[event[@event_class='foo'] and events[event[@event_class='bar']]
Successfull if there is no Event of the event class "foo"
//events[not(event[@event_class='foo'])]
Successfull if there is no Event of the event class "foo"
The default is set to scheduler_id for the JobScheduler running the job if scheduler_id is null or scheduler_id='' or scheduler_id=:schedulerId
schedulerId is null or schedulerId='' or schedulerId=:schedulerId

Werte: true/false Wenn false, werden alle Events gelesen.
Wenn true, werden Events des jeweiligen JobSchedulers gelesen.

Values: true/false If false, then all Events will be read.
If true, then Events of the JobScheduler running the job will be read.

documentation.div: Jobs des JobSchedulers können Events erzeugen, die von einer JobScheduler Supervisor Instanz verarbeitet werden. Dieser Job kann prüfen, ob bestimmte Events existieren. Dazu verarbeitet er Aufträge, die eine Spezifikation der Events enthalten. Je nach dem, ob die Events existieren oder nicht, wird der Auftrag in den next_state oder in den error_state gesetzt.

During job execution in a JobScheduler Workload instance events could be created that should be processed by a JobScheduler Supervisor Instance. This job checks if certain events exists. The job processes orders which are configured with an event specification. Depending on whether these events exist or not the order will be put into the next_state or into the error_state.
